page.title: 01GAZETTEER:SOUTH EAST LUTON
page.content: It is almost certain that William of Normandy visited the royal manor of Luton between October and Christmas 1066 en-route with his army during their long and circuitous progress from Hastings to London. Most of Luton's green S.E.landscape of his time has long since disappeared under residential urban development.Ready motorway,rail and airport access fa- cilitate fast inter-city and inter- national travel whilst urban traffic congestion increases! Shopping facilities are good.Out- door recreational amenities are poor. Most homes have T.V.sets and several elec.powered domestic appliances.With very few exceptions,the children of the area are very well fed and clothed but family instability is a serious and growing problem for both School and the Social Services. { N.W.
